description: An early Scottish ecclesiastical site. Contains Latin stone inscriptions from the 6th CE, one of which reads: 'Here lie the holy and outstanding sacredotes (priests/bishops), that is to say Viventius and Movorious'.
bibliography: Edmonds, F., (2009), Whithorn's renown in the early medieval period: Whithorn, Futerna and magnum monasterium, Friends of the Whithorn Trust, Stranraer

CSCS, (03/14/2013), ‘A magnum monasterium in SW Scotland? New work on Kirkmadrine and its stones’, available at: http://cscs.academicblogs.co.uk/a-magnum-monasterium-in-sw-scotland-new-work-on-kirkmadrine-and-its-stones/
